intro: Microlicia setosa var. angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaf microlicia, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is characterized by its slender, lance-shaped leaves that are densely covered with short, stiff hairs. The plant produces small, clustered white flowers with four petals, which are typically borne on slender pedicels. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is often found in moist, shaded habitats. Its botanical features make it a distinctive species within its genus.
